zgpInfraDevice.h File Reference

The header file describes the proxy/sink specific APIs from high zgp. More...

#include <zcl.h>
#include <zgpCommon.h>

#include <zgpLowGpdf.h>

#define MAX_SINGLE_REPORT_DESC_LEN   25
#define INVALID_LENGTH   0xFF
#define ZGP_REPORT_DESCRIPTOR_TIMEOUT_BIT_MASK   (1u << 0)
#define IS_ZGP_REPORT_DESCRIPTOR_TIMEOUT_PRESENT(a)   (a & ZGP_REPORT_DESCRIPTOR_TIMEOUT_BIT_MASK)
#define ZGP_ATTR_RECORD_REMAINING_LENGTH(a)   (a & 0xF)
#define ZGP_ATTR_VALUE_PRESENT_BIT_POS   5
#define IS_ZGP_ATTR_VALUE_PRESENT(a)   ((a >> ZGP_ATTR_VALUE_PRESENT_BIT_POS) & 0x1)
#define ZGP_DATAPOINT_DESC_NO_OF_ATTRIBUTE_RECORDS_MASK   0x7

enum  _ZGP_InfraDeviceStatus_t {
  ZGP_SUCCESS = 0x00,
  ZGP_ALREADY_IN_COMMISSIONING_MODE = 0x01,
  ZGP_ENDPOINT_NOT_REGISTERED = 0x02,
  ZGP_INVALID_ACTION = 0x03,
  ZGP_NO_FREE_ENTRY = 0x04,
  ZGP_ENTRY_NOT_AVAILABLE = 0x05,
  ZGP_INSUFFICIENT_SPACE_STATUS = 0x06,
  ZGP_NOT_IN_EXPECTED_STATE = 0x07
}

  SUCCESSFUL_COMMISSIONING = 0x00,
  GPD_COMMAND_RECEIVED,
  PAIRING_CONFIG_CMD_RECEIVED,
  SINK_COMM_MODE_REQ_CMD_RECEIVED,

  APP_FUNCTIONALITY_CHECK = 0x00,

}

Detailed Description

The header file describes the proxy/sink specific APIs from high zgp.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

To put local sink in commissioning mode.

Returns:

ZGP_InfraDeviceStatus_t ZGPH_UpdateLocalSinkEntry ( ZGP_SinkTableEntry_t *  sinkEntry,
ZGP_SinkTableActions_t  action 
)

To update sink entry locally on NVM based on the given action.

Parameters:
[in]sinkEntry- entry fields(if proper security key(non-zero) is not provided, this will be derived based on gpsSharedKeyType
[in]action- EXTEND_SINKTABLE_ENTRY/REMOVE_GPD supported
Returns:
status

Returns:
Status.

To set assigned alias used for the GPD to be commissioned.

Parameters:
[in]gpdAssignedAlias- The commissioned 16-bit ID to be used as alias for this GPD
Returns:
Status.

[in]dstAddr- destination address
[in]pairingConfigCmdInfo- pairing config inputs
[in]commReqAppInfo- Application information
[in]endpointInfo- paired endpoints information

[in]index- Entry Index as per the groupList

ZCL_Status_t ZGPH_SendCmdWithCallback ( uint8_t  sourceEndpoint,
uint16_t  clusterId,
uint8_t  commandId,
uint8_t  frameType,
uint8_t  direction,
uint8_t  disableDefaultResponse,
uint16_t  manufacturerCode,
uint8_t  sequenceNumber,
uint8_t  zclPayloadLength,
const uint8_t *  pZclPayload,
ZCL_Addressing_t *  dstAddr,
Notify  pNotificationCallback 
)

Send ZGP cluster command in raw mode.

Parameters:
[in]sourceEndpoint- Endpoint requesting the command
[in]clusterId- Cluster Id
[in]commandId- cluster cmd id
[in]frameType- Universal or Cluster specific command
[in]direction- Client to Server or vice versa
[in]disableDefaultResponse- is the default response is enabled
[in]manufacturerCode- Manufacture code to be used
[in]sequenceNumber- ZCL transaction sequence number
[in]zclPayloadLength- length of payload to be sent
[in]pZclPayload- Payload to be sent
[in]dstAddr- dst addr
[in]pNotificationCallback- function to be called when a response is received
Returns:
zcl status
